intro: Ozoroa dispar, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. Ozoroa dispar is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in regions with mild climates.
